&nbsp; &nbsp; ITEM&nbsp;5.03 Amendments to Articles Incorporation or Bylaws; Change in Fiscal Year &nbsp; &nbsp; (a) On May&nbsp;2, 2016, the Board of Directors (the &#147;Board&#148;) of Berkshire Hathaway Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#147;Company&#148;), amended and restated the Company&#146;s Bylaws effective immediately to, among other things: &nbsp; &nbsp; &#149; &nbsp; Provide the Board flexibility on setting the time and place of the Company&#146;s stockholder meetings; &nbsp; &nbsp; &#149; &nbsp; Require advance notice for stockholders to bring business before any meeting of the Company&#146;s stockholders; &nbsp; &nbsp; &#149; &nbsp; Require advance notice for stockholders to nominate directors of the Company; &nbsp; &nbsp; &#149; &nbsp; Update officer roles, responsibilities, and authority for the current business needs of the Company; &nbsp; &nbsp; &#149; &nbsp; Clarify the voting rights of the Company&#146;s stockholders; &nbsp; &nbsp; &#149; &nbsp; Update the requirements for setting the record date as allowed by Delaware law; &nbsp; &nbsp; &#149; &nbsp; Clarify and update the indemnifications provisions applicable to the Company&#146;s directors and officers; &nbsp; &nbsp; &#149; &nbsp; Update the Bylaws as a whole to conform and be consistent with the General Corporation Law of Delaware: and &nbsp; &nbsp; &#149; &nbsp; Add electronic transmission as an acceptable communication media. The foregoing description of the amendments to the Bylaws does not purport to be complete and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the full text of the Bylaws, attached hereto as Exhibit 3(ii) and incorporated herein by reference. ITEM&nbsp;5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders On April&nbsp;30, 2016, Berkshire Hathaway Inc. held an annual meeting of its shareholders. The agenda items for the meeting along with the vote of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A and Class B common shareholders voting together as a single class with respect to each of the agenda items are shown below. There were two items acted on at that meeting as follows: 1) Election of Directors; and 2) a shareholder proposal requesting that the Berkshire Hathaway insurance division issue a report describing the division&#146;s responses to the risks posed by climate change. Berkshire&#146;s shareholders reelected all of Berkshire&#146;s directors in an uncontested election.
